clinical_study.brief_title: Stockholm Myocardial Infarction With Normal Coronaries (SMINC)-2 Study on Diagnosis Made by Cardiac MRI
clinical_study.official_title: Stockholm Myocardial Infarction With Normal Coronaries (SMINC)-2

brief_summary.textblock: Myocardial infarction with angiographically normal coronary arteries (MINCA) is common (7-8 % of all myocardial infarctions). There are several different causes behind MINCA where "true infarction" due to thromboembolism, myocarditis or Takotsubo stress cardiomyopathy are the main findings. The underlying diagnosis is often made by clinical findings sometimes with the help of cardiac MRI (CMR). Investigators have previously shown that it was possible to give 50 % of the patients a diagnosis made by the combination of clinical findings and CMR made in median 12 days after the acute event. The present study aim at improve the diagnostic accuracy by an early CMR with latest technique.

detailed_description.textblock: The present study aim at improve the diagnostic accuracy in MINCA with an CMR made 2-4 days after the acute event. The aim is to give 70 % of all patients with MINCA (35-70 years old) a definitive diagnosis made by CMR only. One-hundred and fifty patients will be included and compared with a similar historical sample where 50 % of the patients received a diagnosis made by a late CMR and clinical findings. The study has 80 % power to detect this 20 % absolute difference (p <0.05).

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy of an early CMR with the latest technique
primary_outcome.description: Show that the more patients get a definite diagnosis (70%) when compared to a historical sample (50%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with correct diagnosis with echocardiography
secondary_outcome.description: To study the accuracy of echocardiography compared to CMR using ROC

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with a postive CT angiography and infarction on CMR
secondary_outcome.description: To study CT angiography findings in relation to myocardial infarction shown by CMR

arm_group.description: Patients with MINCA prospectively investigated with an early CMR with latest technique
Patients with MINCA investigated earlier with a late CMR (median 12 days)

intervention.description: Intervention performed 2-4 days after admission to hospital with the latest CMR technique including sensitive oedema sequences using T1 mapping

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 35-70 years
- Fullfill the diagnosic criteria of myocardial infarction
- Normal coronary angiography or minor atheromatosis
- Sinus rythm on ECG at admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous myocardial infarction
- Known cardiomyopathy
- Pacemaker or claustrophobia
- Severe chronic obstructive lung or kidney disease
- Pulmonary embolism
